memory_verse.label: Memory Verse
memory_verse.text: “Therefore be ye also ready: for in such an hour as ye think not the Son of man cometh.” ( Matthew 24:44)

devotion.label: Insight / Reflection
devotion.text:
The world’s eyes are now fixed on the mysterious interstellar object 3I/ATLAS. Scientists discuss, media debates, and millions eagerly wait to see what it means for humanity. Some exaggerate its danger, some dismiss it, and others bury their heads in the sand like ostriches pretending nothing is happening.

People stay awake for cosmic news, but sleep through divine truth. They study the stars, but ignore the Bright and Morning Star. Many expect a rock from space, but forget the Rock of Ages who promised, “I will come again.”

How sad that even believers have lost the eagerness for Christ’s return no discussions, no research, no expectation! The enemy has cleverly turned human attention toward the sky but away from the Savior.

Beloved, let us shift our focus. His coming is far more certain than any comet’s orbit. Let us live sanctified, purified, and gloriously ready for His return. The media may not announce it  but we must proclaim it: “Jesus is coming soon!”

quote.label: Today's Quote
quote.text: “The great question is not when He will come, but whether we are ready for His coming.”  Charles Spurgeon

prayer.label: Prayer
prayer.text: Lord Jesus, awaken our hearts from worldly distractions. Let our eyes look beyond the news of stars and stones to the glorious day of Your appearing. Sanctify us and make us worthy of Your call. Amen.

conclusion.label: A Word to You
text: May your spirit stay watchful and your lamp keep burning. The King is coming be ready to meet Him with joy!

recommended_book.label: Recommended Book
recommended_book.title: The Second Coming of Christ
recommended_book.author: A.W. TOZER
recommended_book.quote: Christ is coming again. He said, I will come again. And he meant that we should believe that he would come again, that he would make two trips to the earth, one to die and one to take his people away.
